oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Easter Parade in downtown Nashville, Tennessee, 1980
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Musicians of the Riders in the Sky group waving to the crowd from a float in the 1980 Easter Parade in downtown Nashville, Tennessee. Riders in the Sky is an American Western music and comedy group which began performing in 1977. This festive springtime parade was enjoyed by many people, with its decorated parade floats, entertainers, and community participation. The event was organized by Kolleen Hudgins, Director of Special Events, under the administration of Mayor Richard Fulton. Forms part of the Kolleen Hudgins, Director of Special Events, Mayor’s Office Collection. 1 b & w photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hudgins, Kolleen; Fulton, Richard
Harvey’s Department Store (Nashville, Tenn.); Riders in the Sky
